name: graphviz-cli
description: Command-line tool for generating graph images from Graphviz source scripts.
author: Ferdinand Prantl <prantlf@gmail.com> (http://prantlf.tk/)

scripts.lint: npm run lint:js && npm run lint:ts
scripts.fix: npm run fix:js && npm run fix:ts
scripts.test:cli: nyc --silent ./bin/graphviz.js -? && nyc --silent --no-clean ./bin/graphviz.js -V && mkdir -p test/actual && cat test/hello.dot | nyc --silent --no-clean ./bin/graphviz.js > test/actual/hello.dot.dot && nyc --silent --no-clean ./bin/graphviz.js -Tsvg -otest/actual/hello.dot.svg test/hello.dot && nyc --silent --no-clean cp test/hello.dot test/actual/hello.dot && nyc --silent --no-clean ./bin/graphviz.js -Tjson -O test/actual/hello.dot && rm test/actual/hello.dot && nyc --silent --no-clean ./bin/graphviz.js -v -Tjson0 -otest/actual/hello.dot.json0 test/hello.dot && nyc --silent --no-clean ./bin/graphviz.js -v -Tplain test/hello.dot > test/actual/hello.dot.plain && cat test/hello.dot | nyc --silent --no-clean ./bin/graphviz.js -v -Tplain-ext -otest/actual/hello.dot.plain-ext && nyc --silent --no-clean ./bin/graphviz.js -Kneato -Tps -otest/actual/hello.dot.ps test/hello.dot && nyc --silent --no-clean ./bin/graphviz.js -y -Tps2 -otest/actual/hello.dot.ps2 test/hello.dot && nyc --silent --no-clean ./bin/graphviz.js -n1 -Tpng -otest/actual/hello.dot.png test/hello.dot && cat test/hello.dot | nyc --silent --no-clean ./bin/graphviz.js -v -Txdot > test/actual/hello.dot.xdot
scripts.test:err: nyc --silent --no-clean ./bin/graphviz.js -Kinvalid || nyc --silent --no-clean ./bin/graphviz.js -v -Tinvalid || nyc --silent --no-clean ./bin/graphviz.js -n2 || nyc --silent --no-clean ./bin/graphviz.js -o || nyc --silent --no-clean ./bin/graphviz.js -K || nyc --silent --no-clean ./bin/graphviz.js -T || nyc --silent --no-clean ./bin/graphviz.js -Ounexpected || nyc --silent --no-clean ./bin/graphviz.js -v -X || true
scripts.test: npm run test:ts && npm run test:cli && npm run test:err && npm run test:cmp && npm run test:cov
scripts.all: npm run build && npm run lint && npm run test
